title: Soundcore V20i by Anker Open-Ear Headphones, Adjustable Ear Hooks, Ultra-Comfort, Snug Fit, Powerful Sound, Clear Calls, IP55, 36H Playtime, Bluetooth 5.4 Wireless Earbuds, Multipoint Connection
priceShippingInformation: FREE delivery Thursday, September 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35 Or Prime members get FREE delivery Monday, September 15. Order within 1 hr 58 mins. Join Prime
features: Ultra-Comfort with Open-Ear Design: Experience matchless comfort even for all-day wear with these non-intrusive, open-ear Bluetooth earbuds.
Enhanced Situational Awareness: V20i open-ear wireless earbuds let you stay connected to the world while enjoying pristine playback. Ideal for both urban life and outdoor ventures.

Four Adjustable Positions for a Secure, Comfy Fit: Easily rotate to find the sweet spot for your ears with these bluetooth earbuds, boosting stability and comfort. Listen and move freely with V20i open-ear earbuds throughout the day.

Powerful Sound with 16mm Drivers: Immerse in rich, resonant bass fueled by V20i's advanced 16mm drivers—featured in these wireless earbuds—with titanium-coated domes and soundcore's proprietary BassUp technology.
Clear Calls with 4 Mics and AI Enhancement: Equipped with four mics and an AI algorithm, V20i open-ear Bluetooth earbuds ensure crisp and clear calls wherever you are.
Customizable Lights for Music in Style: Dive into an audio-visual feast with tune-synced, personalized lights on these wireless earbuds, adding flair and ambiance to every beat.

reviews.text: I am -so- impressed with these earbuds! I work in a slightly loud environment that I also need to communicate with either coworkers or customers throughout every shift, while also moving around a lot and these work like a dream! Sound quality is clear and still immersive despite not being in your ear canal. The comfort is incredible and can be adjusted to your ear size. I tend to use lower volume with these earbuds, even when I'm in a quieter environment, so I feel like my ears are protected from hearing damage. They connected seamlessly to my phone and they reconnect seamlessly after taking them off then putting them back on. Also, the connectivity is -strong-! The sound and microphone stays clear even when I'm away from my phone from across the opposite end of my house. The design of these keep your ears comfortable. I can wear them for hours without feeling -any- discomfort and there's no need to worry about them popping off or out of your ear during active sessions. Bought these after much research on open-ear buds, because I also wanted good call quality in addition to being able to hear my surroundings, and these generally came up on top for call quality on multiple articles comparing different brands of open-ear buds. Was slightly skeptical because of the cost/sale, but felt confidence knowing they're made by Anker. I am absolutely delighted with the quality and performance for the cost I paid. Amazing deal for the price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2025
reviews.title: Anker brand, great quality as usual

reviews.text: As advertised, open ear design - you can hear everything around you pretty clearly. They hang around your ear from the front and tuck in, and are pretty easy to forget once you get used to it. Very lightweight. Sound quality is surprisingly good! Bass response is not as prominent as say airpod pros, but I attribute that to the difference in type, open vs closed. Battery life has been great. I do have a pair of airpod pros, but during use, they end up sliding out, no matter which tip I try. The Anker Soundcore V20i with the hook design stay on no matter how sweaty I get during a workout, and I can still hear everything great without needing transparency mode. Battery life has been surprisingly good, have not had to charge the case yet in about a week's worth of casual use, but I suppose that's expected given Anker's battery background! I do trust Anker as a brand, they have made really reliable battery and charging products so I'm glad I gave these a try.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2025
reviews.title: Affordable but good quality OPEN EAR design earbuds

reviews.text: For the price these open ear headphones deliver amazing sound. I needed open ear so I could listen while being able to hear my wife. I wonder how I waited so long to try these out. They work as advertised. The fit gets a bit getting used to for me, but they definitely are comfortable. They fit securely. I'm happy with the quality. Setup was easy. They charged quickly. I can' t tell you how they work running or working out because I don't, but for listening to a podcast, broadcast or music while being able to hear your surroundings, you cannot best these headphones.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2025
reviews.title: Small Price Delivers Good Sound

reviews.text: The Anker V20i are a small hidden gem for runners. They aren’t marketed as “sport headphones,” but don’t let that fool you — when paired with a Garmin watch, they deliver surprisingly solid performance. I ran for 45 minutes straight this morning without a single audio dropout. The sound is decent — not audiophile-level, but more than good enough for music, podcasts, and motivation on the go. The fit is soft, light, and stable. I almost forgot I was wearing them. For non-demanding ears, these are a fantastic budget choice for daily use and running. I honestly don’t understand why Soundcore doesn’t promote these more for fitness — they outperform many overhyped "sports" earbuds I’ve used in the past.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2025
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem for Runners – Stable, Light, and Surprisingly Good

reviews.text: I've been using wireless earbuds to listen to true crime podcasts at work for quite a few years. I have sensitive ears, so the type of earbud that you just shove into your ear canal doesn't work for me; they hurt my ears. I was finally able to settle on a neckband, with small molded buds that nestle in the outer part of the ear, pointed into the canal. I used soft silicone ear tips that hooked into the upper part of my ear, and they were pretty comfy. However, the neckband was silicone connected to hard plastic, and after a while of putting them on and taking them off, the silicone breaks away from the hard plastic, and while the sound is fine, the earbuds just fall apart. I had three or four of the same neckands, and I finally just got fed up and started looking for something different. Initially, neckband batteries lasted longer than individual earbuds, but now that's not necessarily the case. The problem for me was finding molded earbuds small enough to not hurt my ears. So I found these and decided to give them a try, and I'm very glad I did. They have a silicone piece that hooks over the ear, and the speaker lies up against the outer ear, with four different positions for adjustment. I need a few things with my work earbuds: 1. Battery life. I start my day at 7:30 am, and around 3:30 pm, I get a sound notifying me that the battery is at 20%. I only wear one at a time because I'm at work, and I don't want to be completely shut off from my coworkers should they need to speak to me. If, for some reason, the one bud dies, I can switch to the other one, which is still in the case and charged. 2. Multipoint connection. I have these connected to my tablet, which is how I listen to podcasts, and my cell phone at the same time, so if I get a phone call, it automatically disconnects from the tablet and switches to my ringing phone. 3. Range. I get up from my desk and move around the office, and I've had some earbuds that wouldn't stay connected at as little as 15 feet away. I experimented once with these, and I would say that at approximately 70 feet away from my tablet, around a corner, they started breaking up a bit. That is, by far, the longest range I've ever come across. I also have a restroom that's maybe 30 or 40 feet away with a thick wall separating it from my devices, and they stay connected. 4. Comfort. Once or twice a day, I need to pull the speaker away from my ear for a few seconds because it gets a tiny bit achy, but comparatively, they are comfortable. Bonus: with other earbuds, if I stay out of range for too long, I often have to reconnect when I get back in range. With these, they will automatically reconnect. There's an app that can be used; you can customize the sound and set functions. For instance, you can set the volume to increase or decrease with one tap or two taps, etc. When the battery is low, you can just put them back in the case and they'll charge up again, even without the case being plugged in. I'm very happy that I found these!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2025
reviews.title: Fabulous find

globalReviews.text: Airpod prosu olup iki kere bozulmuş biri biri olarak ürünü fiyatına göre çok çok beğendim. Ankerin kulak üstü Q10 nu da var ondan da çok memnunum. Lakin kulak hassiyetim gereği bunu Anker memnuniyetime güvenerek, iyi fiyat görünce aldım . Hemen belirteyim sesi bana fazlası ile yeterli, lakin genç ya da çok yüksek sesle bass vs. detaylı ayırt edenlerden iseniz deneyim önce derim. Emin olun. Uygulaması detaylı güzel, lakin çok efekt olmasına ragmen ben en iyi en-temiz ses veren "volume-booster". Bence buna odaklanmalılar. Digerleri biraz boğuk sesler çünkü. Belki yeni versiyonlarda artar. O zaman cihaz bu fiyat da kalmaz. Telefon görüşmesi de bence çok iyi. Benim hoşuma giden hiçbir ayarlama yapmadan laptop-cep tel anında değişimleri çok iyi yapıyor, yani hangisi aktif ise (2 cihaz). Kulağa sıkı bağlanması, seviye ayarlama etkili söylemiyorum bile. İlk takarken alışmak lazım. Şamda kayısı bile daha pahalıdır:) Tek umudum orta ve uzun kullanımda bu memnuniyetimin değişmemesi..
globalReviews.title: Benim için budur!

globalReviews.text: I’m a fan of Soundcore products. The V20i is an amazing product, especially given the ridiculously low price. The sound is excellent, due to the 16 mm drivers — large for earbuds— which produces surprisingly good bass. Hard to believe that such good sound comes out of such a tiny product. There is an app for Soundcore products, which an equalizer with 22 sound profiles (I use “Piano”), plus the ability to design a custom profile. One of the profiles is called “Volume booster”, useful for noisy environments. I wear my earbuds mostly for listening to podcasts while walking for exercise. In the past, whenever I wanted to listen to music, I would switch to my Soundcore Life Q30 headphones. Now, with these earbuds, it’s not so necessary. The earbuds are stable, not likely to fall out. I can wear glasses OK with the earbuds, but maybe not all day. There is another model, the V30i, which is not an upgrade. It’s just a different set of specs, including a larger battery (12 hrs instead of 8), less bass boost and fewer sound profiles. Sound-core has released the V40i, which has differently shaped drivers, possibly slightly improved sound and an innovative case. I purchased this product, but returned it because it hurt my ears to wear them.

globalReviews.title: افضل ما اشتريت من سماعات ايربودز

reviewInsights.summary: Customers find these earbuds comfortable, sitting outside the ear without causing pain, and appreciate their high-quality construction and value for money. The earbuds fit well, particularly for those wearing glasses, and offer seamless Bluetooth connectivity to multiple devices. While some customers report amazing battery life, others mention issues with charging. The functionality receives mixed reviews, with some customers reporting that the earbuds stop working altogether.
